intro: Euphrasia officinalis subsp. monticola, commonly known as the alpine eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellow-orange flowers with dark veins. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats at elevations above 1,500 meters. It has narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been traditionally used in herbal remedies for eye and respiratory ailments.
